result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deron D Johnson Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Deron D Johnson Jr in court.  Attorney Thomas James Flanagan in court for Deron D Johnson Jr.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status conference.  State has filed new charges in Case 22CF3684. Attorney Flanagan has been retained by the defendant as to the new case which is currently set for Prelim hearing. Defense requests additional time to review both cases and discuss course of action.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Deron D Johnson Jr not in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas James Flanagan in court for Deron D Johnson Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Annie Louk for Patrick Franken in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Calendar Call.  Court advised that the Defendant is in custody and will be processed in Intake for new charge and requests a further Status conference.  Case adjourned to Br. 9.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Deron D Johnson Jr not in court.  Attorney Thomas James Flanagan in court for Deron D Johnson Jr.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Scheduling conference.  Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State. Court advised defendant is in custody unrelated to this matter. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance until the next court date.  Case adjourned to Br. 9. Calendar call scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 8:30 am.

Defendant Deron D Johnson in court with attorney Thomas James Flanagan.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: West Milwaukee PD Officer B. Makouske. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  
Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 09.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Deron D Johnson in court with Attorney Thomas James Flanagan.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Van Grunsven, Branch 09.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 08/10/2022@1pm
